content.value_statement: Creating unique generative art requires both technical skill and artistic vision. This skill provides a structured framework for producing p5.js algorithmic art with seeded randomness and interactive parameter controls for exploration.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Flow Field
prompt_templates.prompt: Create algorithmic art using a flow field algorithm where particles follow layered Perlin noise vectors. Include controls for particle count, noise scale, and flow speed.

prompt_templates.title: Particle System
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a particle system where particles emerge, evolve, and interact. Include seeded randomness so each seed produces unique but reproducible results. Add color palette controls.

prompt_templates.title: Geometric Patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Create algorithmic art based on recursive subdivision or Voronoi tessellation. The philosophy should emphasize mathematical beauty and emergent complexity. Include recursion depth controls.

prompt_templates.title: Custom Philosophy
prompt_templates.prompt: Develop an original algorithmic philosophy (4-6 paragraphs) and implement it as p5.js code. Express computational processes through emergent behavior, noise functions, and parametric variation. Include appropriate parameter controls for your specific algorithm.

best_practices: Always use seeded randomness (randomSeed and noiseSeed) so that the same seed produces identical output
Design parameters that emerge naturally from the algorithm rather than arbitrary pattern types
Keep the UI structure consistent with Anthropic branding for cohesive user experience
Balance algorithmic complexity with visual clarity - chaos should feel controlled and intentional
anti_patterns: Avoid copying existing artists' work - create original algorithms that express your philosophy
Do not generate static images with randomness - the algorithm should be the art, not the frame
Do not omit seed controls - reproducibility is essential for algorithmic art
Avoid over-parameterization - each control should meaningfully change the aesthetic outcome

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude and Claude Code. It provides instructions for generating p5.js code that runs in any browser.

faq.question: How many parameters should I include?
faq.answer: Include 4-6 parameters that directly control your algorithm. Each should meaningfully change the visual output in distinct ways.

faq.question: Can I export the generated art?
faq.answer: Yes. The template includes a Download button that saves the current view as a PNG file at the canvas resolution.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This is a pure prompt skill. It does not access files, execute commands, or send data anywhere. It only generates code.

faq.question: Why does the same seed produce different results?
faq.answer: It should not. Proper seeded randomness ensures reproducibility. If results vary, check that randomSeed and noiseSeed are called correctly.

faq.question: How is this different from other art generators?
faq.answer: Unlike image generators, this creates living algorithms. Each run expresses an algorithmic philosophy through mathematical relationships, emergent behavior, and parametric variation - producing unique, reproducible artwork.
